RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 13100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 26. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, all owed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COLONEL MOORHEAD set the early pace and was clear entering the backstretch, well handled and drew off on the turn and then was roused nearing the furlong marker and widened the advantage then was eased up late to prove much the best. TRIPLE A. PLUS tracked the pace on the inside and saved ground throughout, ridden along on the turn but could not keep pace with the winner, but won the battle for the place award. CHARGING LION stalked the early pace and then chased the winner on the turn two wide but proved no match for that rival, outfinished for the place award. THE GREAT CASBY was settled on the inside and had no response. SAMARONTI was settled and three wide on the turn and failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Triple A. Plus
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, saved ground turn, won battled for place

ENTRY.NAME: Charging Lion
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2 wide, chased turn, outfinished place

ENTRY.NAME: The Great Casby
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Moorhead
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, drew off turn, roused 1/8, widened, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Samaronti
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle 3 wide, failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Turf CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs. Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course it will be run on the main track at One Mile. If more than 10 horses remain it will be run at One Mile and Seventy Yards.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIERCE AND STRONG was allowed to settle early three to four wide, made a three wide move on the turn and drew off smartly in the lane to prove much the best under strong handling, sharp. WARRIOR'S CAUSE set the early pressured pace two wide, then drew clear on the backstretch and dropped to the inside, then was headed leaving the turn and proved to be no match for the winner while stating on to be clearly second best. BARN SWALLOW chased the pace and made a mild bid on the inside on the turn but weakened, bested rest. SYLVIA I AM chased the pace three wide and weakened. HE AROSE passed the tiring rivals. QUINCY ADAMS was settled back on the inside and failed to menace. DAGDA pressed the early pace on the inside, three wide on the backstretch while chasing the pace and retreated. JEALOUS RED was fractious in the gate, checked shortly after the start and then was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Barn Swallow
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, mild bid turn, weakened, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Quincy Adams
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back inside, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Jealous Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, checked after start, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Dagda
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside, chased 3 wide 1/2, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior's Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace 2 wide, drew clear 1/2, headed upper, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Sylvia I Am
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Fierce and Strong
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide 1/2, 3 wide move, drew off, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: He Arose
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, passed tiring rivals,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs. Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed in advisable by management to run this race over the turf course it will be run on the main track at One Mile. If more than 10 horses remain it will be run at One Mile and Seventy Yards.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIGHTNING RIDGE stalked the pace and amde a three wide bid on the turn to draw clear by the quarter pole, dropped to the inside leaving the turn while clear, then held on to prove best under a drive. HANFORD was settled two wide, advanced on the turn but was blocked nearing the quarter pole and had to steady, then found room on the inside by the furlong marker and closed well, then shifted off the inside late and kept cloisng to just miss. CITY OF GOD vied for the lead on the inside, fell off the pace leaving the quarter pole, angled off the inside nearing the furlong marker and ran on. LA PAZ was four wide into the first turn, chased the pace three to four wide, made a four wide bid on the turn but needed more late. DOUBLE O OTTO steadied on the first turn in between rivals, then settled into stride and made a five wide move on the turn and flattened out. FIFTH ELEMENT was allowed to settle early, inside on the backstretch and advanced on the turn on the inside but was blocked nearing the quarter pole, steadied slightly and then weakened in the drive. ALWAYS THERE vied for the lead two wide and weakened in the lane. BOOK RUNNER lacked a rally. LETSGETLUCKYTONITE showed little. WINNING CANDY chased the pace on the inside and stopped on the turn, eased and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: City of God
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, angled out 1/8, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Always There
ENTRY.OWNER: McClellan Erin C and Saul Kenneth T
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 2 wide, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Lightning Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide turn, drew clear, held on,driving

ENTRY.NAME: La Paz
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, chased 3-4 wide, bid 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Letsgetluckytonite
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, stopped, eased, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Fifth Element
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, advanced turn, blocked 1/4, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Double O Otto
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied first turn, bid 5 wide turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Hanford
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, blocked,steadied 1/4, closed inside,angled,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Book Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, lacked rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 26 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOCTOR ABBIE was off slowly, recovered to tracked the pace two wide, three wide into the lane and angled in as leader drifted out, closed up the inside to get up with a hundred yards to go and edged clear, driving. WILL TAKE ROSES set the early pace while unchallenged, then drew out on the turn and was three wide into the lane, drifted out by the furlong marker and then was shifted in to challenge rival closing on the inside but was caught, second best. GINGERS WISH chased the pace and was three wide on the backstretch and weakened, held show award. MELODIA was allowed to settle early, saved ground on the turn and had no rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Gingers Wish
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, weakened, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Abbie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, tracked pace, 3 wide 1/4, angled in, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Will Take Roses
ENTRY.COMMENT: set unchallenged pace, drew out turn, drifted 1/8, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Melodia
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, no rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 26 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 26 Al lowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUCKS ARE MOVING was allowed to settle early, shifted out and circled the field six wide leaving the quarter pole and drew away in the final furlong to prove best under a drive. MAJOR THOMAS tracked the early pace three wide, made a five wide bid by the quarter pole, took over leaving the turn but could not go with the winner in the final furlong while being clearly second best. CAPTAIN CHAZZ vied for the lead between rivals, then was bumped repeatedly by the seven sixteenths, made a inside bid by the quarter pole to vie for command, but weakened in the drive, bested rest. ON THE RIM was allowed to settle early, made a mild move on the inside on the turn but could not sustain that bid. GET DOWN BROWN vied for the lead three wide and in between rivals, then was bumped repeatedly and then checked entering the turn, then checked again by the three eighths and dropped back, rough trip. SHY DA RUNNER vied for the lead four wide, bumped by the seven sixteenths and then was still vying for command by the quarter pole and then was empty in the drive. LILTONYTWOPHONES vied for the lead on the inside, then was getting out on the turn and stopped in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Bucks Are Moving
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, circled 6 wide 1/4 pole, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Liltonytwophones
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, got out turn, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Major Thomas
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, bid 5 wide, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Chazz
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between, bumped 7/16, inside bid 1/4, weakened, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: On the Rim
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside move turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Get Down Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between 3 wide, bumped, checked repeatedly, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Shy Da Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 4 wide, bumped 7/16, empty stretch,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 26. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OBROTHER ITSYLVIA was rated along the inside, two wide on the turn and then made a bid when straightened and split rivals by the furlong marker and drew clear to prove best while being on the left lead, driving. COAST TO COAST vied for the lead on the inside and then dueled for command on the turn, could not go with the winner late while running on gamely for the place award. WOLFINBARGER vied for the lead between rivals by the half mile marker, then dueled for command three wide on the turn, made a bid to gain a short lead off the turn but faded the final furlong, held show awafrd. WHO YOU SAY I AM vied fir the early lead three wide, then fell off the duel to stalk the pace on the turn, came four wide into the lane and had no kick while finishing willingly. LEAVE 'EM LOADED was four wide early and dropped back. GUSHING OIL was reserved early on the inside and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Obrother Itsylvia
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, 2 wide turn, split rivals 1/8, clear, left lead

ENTRY.NAME: Gushing Oil
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Coast to Coast
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, dueled rail 1/4, no match, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Wolfinbarger
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead between horses, dueled 3 wide, bid, faded, held 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Who You Say I Am
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, stalked pce turn, came 4 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Leave 'Em Loaded
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide early, dropped back,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLETCHER STATION was rated on the inside, shifted out leaving the five sixteenths and came four wide into the lane, then raced a little green when straightened, then closed well on the outside to get up and edged away late under a drive. WHISKIED UP set the pace on the inside and shook clear on the turn, then turned back the bid from SIR STEELE by the furlong marker but was caught late by the winner, second best. SIR STEELE was rated along on the outside, made a three wide move on the turn to loom boldly off the turn but flattened out the final furlong, bested rest. DON'T QUESTION ME was rated three wide and in between rivals early, then weakened. HE'S FANCY FREE was settled four wide and was not a threat. REIGNING CHAMPION stalked the pace two to three wide and tired. MARY'S LITTLE MAN was settled inside to two wide and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Mary's Little Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Fletcher Station
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, shift out 5/16, came 4 wide, closed, clear late,

ENTRY.NAME: He's Fancy Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide backstretch, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskied Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, turned back bid 1/8, caught late, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Reigning Champion
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2-3 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Question Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated between horses, 3 wide turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Steele
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated outside, 3 wide move, flattened out, bested rest
